summary: This is an amended notification letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida to attorney Michael E. Dutko, regarding a victim in the Jeffrey Epstein case. It corrects information from a prior letter and outlines the terms of Epstein's non-prosecution agreement, including his guilty plea to state charges, the appointment of a victim's attorney representative, and the conditions for civil claims under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He entered a guilty plea to state charges of solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution and was sentenced to imprisonment and community control. The federal prosecution was deferred in favor of the state plea.

persons.name: Michael E. Dutko
persons.context: He is the recipient of this letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office, being asked to provide amended notice to his client, an identified victim.

persons.name: Robert Josefsberg
persons.context: Selected by an independent Special Master to represent victims in civil litigation against Epstein. His services are to be provided at no cost to the victims, as Epstein is obligated to pay his fees and costs.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: He is identified as Epstein's attorney. The letter states that if a victim has selected other counsel and decides to pursue a claim, Goldberger should be contacted.

connections.description: Josefsberg is the attorney representative selected to represent victims in civil litigation against Epstein. Epstein is obligated to pay Josefsberg's fees and costs for this representation.
Goldberger is identified as Epstein's attorney, to be contacted regarding civil claims from victims.
Dutko is instructed that Josefsberg will contact him regarding representing his client, a victim, in civil matters against Epstein.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty in Palm Beach County Circuit Court to felony solicitation of prostitution and procurement of minors for prostitution. He was sentenced to 12 months' imprisonment, followed by 6 months' imprisonment, then 12 months of Community Control.

events.title: Prior Victim Notification
events.description: A prior letter was sent to a victim (via her attorney) containing some inaccurate information, which this document amends.

events.title: Amended Victim Notification Sent
events.description: This amended notification letter is sent to attorney Michael Dutko to correct information and formally outline the terms of the agreement between Epstein and the United States.

locations: 250 Australian Avenue South, Suite 1400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to state charges (solicitation and procurement of minors for prostitution) on June 30, 2008, receiving an 18-month custodial sentence followed by 12 months of community control.

The federal government agreed to defer prosecution in favor of the state plea, subject to conditions including the appointment of a victim's attorney representative (Robert Josefsberg) whose fees Epstein must pay.

Victims are offered a path to sue Epstein under 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255, where Epstein agrees not to contest jurisdiction, liability, or an agreed-upon amount of damages, though this is not construed as an admission of liability.
Epstein's attorney for civil matters is identified as Jack Goldberger of Atterbury Goldberger and Weiss in West Palm Beach.
The document is an amended notice, correcting inaccuracies in a prior victim notification letter dated July 20, 2008.
